about.text: Electrical engineer turned QA engineer with a genuine passion for data, systems, and the craft of building reliable software. I care about quality at every level ‚Äî in code, in people, and in experience. Outside of the terminal I search for interesitng people and experiences
There's a lot of things I would love to do. Some I already did and would like to keep improving, this is how I keep track.

bullets: Ensured end-to-end quality of the NDCX NDC API platform by defining and executing test plans within a SAFe/Scrum team.
Performed exploratory, functional, and end-to-end testing of airline, GDS and payment integrations via APIs and UI flows.
Designed automated regression tests in Python (internal framework + Robot Framework); reviewed C++ changes to assess testing impact.
Led design and implementation of the CI/CD testing pipeline (Jenkins, BIRD), integrating automated suites into deployments.
Managed user stories, test cases, and defects in Jira and Octane; mentored juniors and contributed to team-wide testing standards.
Functional, integration, and regression testing on embedded software systems for automotive ECUs.
Testing platform for Autonomous Driving (BMW / AUTOSAR) using TDFNext Framework with Hardware-in-Loop (HiL) simulation.
Stack size management for automotive embedded systems ‚Äî integration of Gliwa T1 for runtime measurements.
Agile environment; collaborated across developers, project managers, and clients to report testing progress and risks.
Browser automation with no-code tools and Python, applying ISTQB techniques to ensure optimal web app functionality.
QA strategy design, Agile methodologies, and efficient bug tracking.

interships or short period.org: Institute of Systems and Robotics, Univ. Coimbra
bullets: Applied computer vision and machine learning to recognise and authenticate images using advanced image descriptors.
Technology creates unique stochastic markings to authenticate high-end products ‚Äî currently deployed in tobacco package stamps.
Extracted forensic features (particles, faces, fingerprints) for use in identity documents. Collaboration with Portugal's National Mint (INCM).
Created and managed marketing campaigns, social media content, and website copywriting.
Speak is a non-profit organization focused on breaking language barrier between communities by providing a platform for people to have an easier integration.
Developed front-end and back-end features on their web application using the OutSystems Platform.
UI improvements in HTML and CSS; collaborated with multidisciplinary teams on project planning.
Organised all logistics for trips and events across Portugal for international students ‚Äî accommodations, transport, activities.
Provided training and onboarding for new members.

Social media content creation, event planning, financial oversight, and organisational governance.
